body.p:
Owingsville
Bath co Ky.
Aug 3rd 64
His. Excellency
Thos E. Bramlett.
Govr of Ky.

Your petitioners would most Respectfully State that our county is infested with the most desperate men that i known in this war Union citizens are compell to Seek there corn fields of a night to save them Selves from Brutal Murder. infact a great many are leaving there houses and families at the mercy of such men -- but there frequent and Desperate murders cannot have failed to have met your notice

the Government has So fer failed to give us protection although we have Sent many of our best men in the field. we can now only look to you for protection and we most Earnestly pray that you Send us a Suficient no of State troops --.we beleave with Capt. W. Werens Co -- our ^county^ could be kept perfactly quiet --

W Taylor
John Mosler Jailor
R. Coulthard Clk, B, C,
Samuel McQuitley
George Spencer
George Coyler
Jas. L. Warren

Owingsville Bath Co. Ky.
>August 3rd 1864.
Taylor. W. Miller Jno & C.

Giving the reasons why troops should be stationed in their County. And requesting that Warren's Company be sent for their protection To the Gov. and by him referred with this endorsement. "We have no State troops to send. Capt Warren is of what command?"

>Aug 17th 1864 Answered on L. B. B. P. 37 --
Recd I. G. O. Aug 16 -- 1864.
